### Reading, Converting, Analyzing and Plotting Serum Corticosterone 
### Administered Rats 
#### Reading in Serum Corticosterone Administered Rat Data for LD and rLEN
```{r}
# Reading Serum Corticosterone Administered Rats for LD
readxl::read_excel(path ="../Circadian Disruption ZT Data.xlsx",
                   sheet = "Serum Corticosterone",
                    range ="N2:R11") -> Circadian_CorticoSerum_LD

# Reading Serum Corticosterone Administered Rats for rLEN
readxl::read_excel(path ="../Circadian Disruption ZT Data.xlsx",
                   sheet = "Serum Corticosterone",
                    range ="U2:Y12") -> Circadian_CorticoSerum_rLEN
```


#### Converting Data into Usable Format for Extracting VOIs and Plotting
```{r}
# Data Conversion to get Individual Points for LD Serum Corticosterone Rat Model
# X value is Zeitgeber time, Y value is Concentration in mg of Drug/Content

# Loads Initial Dataset for LD Serum Corticosterone Rats and Removes Outliers
outlier_detection(Circadian_CorticoSerum_LD) -> out_res_LDCS
filter_outliers(Circadian_CorticoSerum_LD, 
                out_res_LDCS) ->  LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter

# Performs Data Carpentry on Filtered LD MS Dataset and Removes 'NA's,
## filters out ZT of 24
LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(`0`,`6`,`12`, `18`, `24`), names_to = "ZT", 
               values_to = "Concentration(mg)") %>%
  drop_na(`Concentration(mg)`) %>%
  mutate(ZT = as.numeric(ZT)) %>%
  arrange(ZT) -> LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter
LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter %>%
  # Filter out ZT of 24
  filter(ZT != 24)  -> LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_data

# Creating Cosinor Model for LD MS Rat Plots
cosinor.lm(`Concentration(mg)` ~ time(ZT), period = 24,
           data = LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter) -> cosMod_LD_CS
# Creating Cosinor Model for LD MS Rat Data Analysis
cosinor.lm(`Concentration(mg)` ~ time(ZT), period = 24,
           data = LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_data) -> cosMod_LD_CS_data

```

```{r}
# Data Conversion to get Individual Points for rLEN Serum Corticosterone 
# Rat Model X value is Zeitgeber time, Y value is Concentration in 
# mg of Drug/Content

# Loads Initial Dataset for rLEN Serum Corticosterone Rats and Removes Outliers
outlier_detection(Circadian_CorticoSerum_rLEN) -> out_res_rLENCS
filter_outliers(Circadian_CorticoSerum_rLEN, 
                out_res_rLENCS) ->  rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter

# Performs Data Carpentry on Filtered LD MS Dataset and Removes 'NA's
rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(`0`,`6`,`12`, `18`, `24`), names_to = "ZT", 
               values_to = "Concentration(mg)") %>%
  drop_na(`Concentration(mg)`) %>%
  mutate(ZT = as.numeric(ZT)) %>%
  arrange(ZT) -> rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter
rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter %>%
  # Filter out ZT of 24
  filter(ZT != 24)  -> rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_data

# Creating Cosinor Model for LD MS Rat Plots
cosinor.lm(`Concentration(mg)` ~ time(ZT), period = 24,
           data = rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter) -> cosMod_rLEN_CS
# Creating Cosinor Model for LD MS Rat Plot Data Analysis
cosinor.lm(`Concentration(mg)` ~ time(ZT), period = 24,
           data = rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_data) -> cosMod_rLEN_CS_data
```


#### Calculating the Y-limits for Plots of Cosinor Fit
```{r}
# Finding the max Y-value Across Both Datsets in Order to Set Y-limits of 
# Future Plot
max(rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter$`Concentration(mg)`, 
    LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter$`Concentration(mg)`) -> CS_max
ceiling(CS_max / 5) * 5 -> y_peak
```


#### Creating Plots of Original Data with Cosinor Fit Overlayed for Rat Models
```{r}
# Creating Individual Plots of Rat Datasets w/ Cosinor Fits
## Loads Function plot_cosinor Into Global Environment, Which Takes cosMod 
## Model, Original Dataset, Plot Title and Desired x-breaks (currently set for
## Zetigeber Time, to see how to change to regular time see function notes) and
## Generates Plot of Original Data with Overlayed Cosinor Fit Model

# Creating Plot for LD CS Rat Model
plot_cosinor(cosMod_LD_CS, LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter, 
             "LD Serum Corticosterone", "LD",
             x_breaks = seq(0, 24, by = 6)) -> mod_plot_LD_CS


# Creating Plot for rLEN CS Rat Model
plot_cosinor(cosMod_rLEN_CS, rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_Filter, 
             "rLEN Serum Corticosterone", "rLEN",
             x_breaks = seq(0, 24, by = 6)) -> mod_plot_rLEN_CS
```


#### Performing Cosinor Analysis for Rat Datasets
```{r}
# Creating Table of Data VOIs for LD Serum Corticosterone Rat Model
## Produces Table of Pertinent Values (Mesor, Amplitude, Acrophase, Bathyphase)
## and Converts Table into Graphical Object for Figure Creation
extract_cosinor(cosMod_LD_CS_data, LD_Circadian_CorticoSerum_data,
                "LD") -> LD_extract_output
LD_CS_Results_table <- LD_extract_output$results_table
LD_CS_Results_grob <- LD_extract_output$results_grob


# Creating Table of Data VOIs for rLEN Serum Corticosterone Rat Model
## Produces Table of Pertinent Values (Mesor, Amplitude, Acrophase, Bathyphase)
## and Converts Table into Graphical Object for Figure Creation
extract_cosinor(cosMod_rLEN_CS_data, rLEN_Circadian_CorticoSerum_data,
                "rLEN") -> rLEN_extract_output
rLEN_CS_Results_table <- rLEN_extract_output$results_table
rLEN_CS_Results_grob <- rLEN_extract_output$results_grob
```


#### Performing Zero Amplitude Test Analysis on Rat Models
```{r}
# Zero-Amplitude Analysis of Cosinor Fit
## Creating Table of Zero Amplitude VOIs for LD Serum Corticosterone Rat Model

# Produces Table of Pertinent Values (df1, df2, f-value, p-value) and Converts 
# Table into Graphical Object for Figure Creation
zero_amp(cosMod_LD_CS_data, "LD") -> LD_zero_output
LD_CS_amp_test_Results <- LD_zero_output$results_table
LD_CS_amp_test_grob <- LD_zero_output$results_grob


# Produces Table of Pertinent Values (df1, df2, f-value, p-value) and Converts 
# Table into Graphical Object for Figure Creation
zero_amp(cosMod_rLEN_CS_data, "rLEN") -> rLEN_zero_output
rLEN_CS_amp_test_Results <- rLEN_zero_output$results_table
rLEN_CS_amp_test_grob <- rLEN_zero_output$results_grob
```


#### Creating Side-by-Side Plot Comparison of Cosinor Fit Models for LD and 
#### rLEN Rat Models
```{r, fig.width= 15}
# Set the working directory to the folder where you want to save the plot
plot_dir <- here("Combined Plots")
# Create the directory if it does not exist
if (!dir.exists(plot_dir)) dir.create(plot_dir)  

# Save the plot as PDF in the specified directory
pdf(file.path(plot_dir, "combined_CS_plots.pdf"), width=15, height=6)
grid.arrange(mod_plot_LD_CS, mod_plot_rLEN_CS, ncol = 2)
dev.off()
```

#### Amplitude Analysis VOIs
